@zwarrior Buffett has said that he wouldn't buy $MSFT because of his relationship with Gates, people would accuse him of insider trading: 
 
“If something happened a week later, a month later, in terms of [Microsoft] having better earnings than expected or making an acquisition—anything—both Bill and I would, incorrectly, but would be a target of suggestions and accusations, perhaps even, that somehow he had told me something, or vice versa,” 
 
He was right, because they bought $ATVI in December, a bunch of people think (wrongly) they had inside information.  
 
Reputation means a lot to Buffett. 
 
https://fortune.com/2018/05/05/warren-buffett-berkshire-hathaway-microsoft-stock/

$BRK.B $ATVI Buffett abstained from buying $MSFT for decades despite knowing it was a great company, because of his relationship with Gates. He said this: 
 
“If something happened a week later, a month later, in terms of [Microsoft] having better earnings than expected or making an acquisition—anything—both Bill and I would, incorrectly, but would be a target of suggestions and accusations, perhaps even, that somehow he had told me something, or vice versa,”  
 
There is no way he would throw that all away and sign off on committing a crime by using insider information to buy $ATVI to add an extra $.2 billion, to their $150 billion cash pile, which is the equivalent of 3 days worth of operating earnings for Berkshire. Not everything is a conspiracy.  
 
https://fortune.com/2018/05/05/warren-buffett-berkshire-hathaway-microsoft-stock/

@RockStrong @calguy489 There is no way they would commit a crime to add what is the equivalent of 3 extra days of operating earnings to their cash pile. It was such a small amount that Buffett most likely had little to do with this. Buffett avoided buying $MSFT for decades because his relationship with Gates would give the appearance of impropriety. There is no way he would throw that away for a miniscule gain in $ATVI.  
 
“If something happened a week later, a month later, in terms of [Microsoft] having better earnings than expected or making an acquisition—anything—both Bill and I would, incorrectly, but would be a target of suggestions and accusations, perhaps even, that somehow he had told me something, or vice versa,” Buffett said at the Berkshire meeting in Omaha. 
 
There is no way they had info on this.
